page.title: 19J. McINTOSH PATRICK, DUNDEE
page.content: One of the most celebrated public figures in this area of DUNDEE is{ {James McIntosh Patrick,}born in 1907. His father was a distinguished local architect. He was educated at Morgan Academy,Dundee, and attended Glasgow School of Art. During his student days he exhibited his work at the Royal Academy. He graduated from Glasgow in 1927. The following year he exhibited his work at the Royal Academy. Between 1935-1973, his awards included the{ {Guthrie Award}in 1939 for his painting{'Marion'.}He has exhibited in galleries thoughout the country. At the age of 78, he is still painting.He has produced a number of paintings of local landscapes and Dundee buildings which have proved very popular. Many can still be seen in public and private collections.
